raw_text:
Carry On star Patsy Rowlands dies
 
 Actress Patsy Rowlands, known to millions for her roles in the Carry On films, has died at the age of 71.
 
 Rowlands starred in nine of the popular Carry On films, alongside fellow regulars Sid James, Kenneth Williams and Barbara Windsor. She also carved out a successful television career, appearing for many years in ITV's well-loved comedy Bless This House. Rowlands died in Hove on Saturday morning, her agent said.
 
 Born in January 1934, Rowlands won a scholarship to the Guildhall School of Speech and Drama scholarship when she was just 15.
 
 After spending several years at the Players Theatre in London, she made her film debut in 1963 in Tom Jones, directed by Tony Richardson. She made her first Carry On film in 1969 where she appeared in Carry On Again Doctor. Rowlands played the hard-done-by wife or the put-upon employee as a regular Carry On star. She also appeared in Carry On at your Convenience, Carry On Matron and Carry On Loving, as well as others.
 
 In recent years she appeared in BBC mini-series The Cazalets and played Mrs Potts in the London stage version of Beauty and the Beast. Agent Simon Beresford said: "She was just an absolutely favourite client She never complained about anything, particularly when she was ill, she was an old trouper. "She was of the old school - she had skills from musical theatre and high drama, that is why she worked with the great and the good of directors. "She didn't mind always being recognised for the Carry On films because she thoroughly enjoyed making them. She was a really lovely person and she will be much missed." Her last appearance on stage was as Mrs Pearce in the award-winning production of My Fair Lady at the National Theatre. Previously married, she leaves one son, Alan. Her funeral will be a private, family occasion, with a memorial service at a later date.
llama3.2:1b: Patsy Rowlands, 71, has died after being ill and passing away in Hove. She was known for her roles in Carry On films alongside Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Barbara Windsor, and appeared in TV series such as Bless This House. Born in 1934, she won a scholarship to the Guildhall School of Speech and Drama at age 15.
llama3.2:3b: Patsy Rowlands, actress known for Carry On films and Bless This House, dies at 71. Born in January 1934, she won a Guildhall School of Speech and Drama scholarship at 15. She made her film debut in Tom Jones (1963) and appeared in nine Carry On films, alongside Sid James and Barbara Windsor.
gemma2:2b: Patsy Rowlands, an actress known for her roles in the Carry On films, died at age 71. She appeared in nine of the popular films alongside other actors like Sid James and Barbara Windsor. Her career also included success in television with "Bless This House".  She was a respected performer with skills from musical theatre who enjoyed working on projects like those directed by Tony Richardson. Rowlands leaves her son, Alan.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Patsy Rowlands, 71, actress and regular Carry On cast member, died on Saturday morning in Hove. She was born January 1934. Patsy Rowlands made her film career debut with the Carry On films in 1963, appearing in three of them: "Carry On Again Doctor", "Carry On Matron" and "Carry On Loving". She appeared in other Carry On films including "Bless This House", "My Fair Lady" and a role as Mrs. Potts in the National Theatre production of "My Fair Lady". In her career, she was also active on television with roles in ITV's comedy show "Bless This House" and the ITV sitcom "The Cazalets". Rowlands had been well-regarded by audiences for decades and would have delighted many fans.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Patsy Rowlands, known for her roles in Carry On films, has died at age 71 after suffering from cancer. She starred in nine of the popular Carry On films alongside Sid James, Kenneth Williams, and Barbara Windsor.
qwen2.5:3b: Actress Patsy Rowlands, known for her roles in Carry On films, died at 71 after a successful career including television series and stage performances like Beauty and the Beast's Mrs Potts. Born in 1934, she won a scholarship to Guildhall School of Speech and Drama at age 15. She appeared in nine Carry On films alongside regulars such as Sid James and Kenneth Williams. Rowlands also had a successful TV career with ITV's Bless This House. In her later years, she starred in BBC mini-series The Cazalets and the stage production of My Fair Lady. Her last appearance was in National Theatre's award-winning production of My Fair Lady. Agent Simon Beresford described her as an old trouper who enjoyed making Carry On films despite fame. Rowlands leaves one son, Alan, and will have a private funeral with memorial service at a later date.

Rowlands died on Saturday morning, with her agent said.

Patsy Rowlands, 71 years old, passed away on Saturday morning in Hove. Known for her roles in nine Carry On films with Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Barbara Windsor, and television work on ITV’s Bless This House, she was a beloved actress with a legacy that includes appearances in BBC shows like The Cazalets and the London stage version of Beauty and the Beast. Born on January 1934, she won a Guildhall scholarship at 15. Her professional career began in 1963 with "Tom Jones," and she appeared in several Carry On films beyond her first appearance. Patsy was described as an old-school artist who never complained when ill, earning a warm fondness for her work. She recently starred in "Carry On At Your Convenience" and appeared as Mrs Pearce in *My Fair Lady*. With one son, Alan, the funeral will be private with a memorial service later.
tinyllama:1.1b: Born in January 1934, actress Patsy Rowlands (also known as Pat Rowlands) died on Saturday morning at the age of 71. Rowlands starred in nine films starring in Carry On series between 1969 and 2010. She appeared in 25 Carry On films, including notable roles in Carry On Again Doctor (1973), Carry On Matron (1974), and Carry On Lovin' (1973). Rowlands was known for her versatile performance style across genres, particularly in musical theatre and high drama. She enjoyed working with the great and the good of director, and died after battling illness. Her funeral will be a private family occasion followed by a memorial service at a later date.
